channel.title: Harvard Forest on MKLau
channel.description: Recent content in Harvard Forest on MKLau

item.title: Published! Regime shifts in a microecosytem
item.description: My manuscript on the dynamics of the pitcher plant microecosystem just got accepted at Ecological Modeling! You can view a pre-print here.

item.title: Released! Draft *Aphaenogaster* genomes
item.description: Just finished the final assembly of draft genomes for six species of seed ants from the genus Aphaenogaster. You can read the pre-print of the paper here. The sequences will be released on NCBI in May 2018 check them out here.

item.title: Published! If these data could talk...
item.description: Our paper on applications of data provenance is out in Nature Scientific Data!

item.title: Data provenance for scientific reproducibility
item.description: I’ll be joinging a team based at Harvard University (Computer Science and Harvard Forest) and Mount Holyoke College to work on methods for capturing and storing information about scientific computations. We will be focusing on Data Provenance, which is a formal record of the processes that created a given data set.

item.title: Harvard Forest REU Program
item.description: I have mentored students in association with the Harvard Forest Research Experience for Undergraduates (REU) Program. The REU is an ecology focused opportunity for undergraduates to get hands-on experience conducting field and laboratory research.

item.title: Harvard Forest Postdoctoral Fellowship
item.description: I have accepted an invitation to conduct postdoctoral studies at Harvard Forest (Harvard Univeristy) to continue my research on the impacts of genetic variation on ecological networks. I’ll be working with Dr. Aaron Ellison who has studied the impacts of ecological disturbance on a broad variety of ecological systems.
